Review: Unfortunately, I don't recommend these linen sheets given their roughness and pilling, and I say that having had many linen products and knowing what to expect from new linen.  I think shoppers would be better off spending $10-$20 more, which isn't much at this price range, for a set from brands like Land's End, Pottery Barn, or Quince.  Or spending 2x/3x on brands like Parachute or Brooklinen.  Or possibly forgoing linen sheets for a nice cotton percale set or viscose set.I've had other flax linen items, including clothing as well as bedding.  The duvet covers have ranged from higher-end brands like Parachute to lower-priced brands from Amazon and elsewhere. This linen was very rough and sandpapery out of the packaging.  And even after a thorough washing and drying (and the expected large amount of lint from washing linen items for the first time) this sheet set is still rough.  It also ended up with dozens of little pills all over after the first wash (not to be mistaken with the slubs, which are the little lumps that are natural to linen fabric).Most linen, even high-quality stuff, may start a little "rough," but between how rough these sheets are even after washing AND the pilling, I think these may be lower-quaity linen instead of high-quality flax linen that the price would indicate.The weave is also interesting but doesn't have a nice feel. It looks and feels more like a paper towel than other linen items I have, which have a more visible close weave or plain weave.  It doesn't feel pleasant to my skin.I was looking for a set as an alternative to the viscose sheets I've been using in warm weather—something comfortable and a bit warmer but still breathable. I hoped these sheets, especially with a list price of $119.99 for a king set (at the time of writing), would be that set, but they are too rough for my taste.The sizing and color are accurate, and the stitching is done well.  Unfortunately, those "pros" (which meet my baseline expectations at this price) don't make up for the roughness and pilling.

Review: I'm fussy when it comes to sheets. I live in Florida and I think you should have different sheets for summer and winter. With that said, I truly feel you can use these sheets year round.I washed them before I used them the first time and I thought they felt OK. After the third washing I thought they were amazing and they just keep getting better.These Threadmill sheets are 100% cotton and have an 800 thread count. I got them on sale but I do not feel $100 for king size sheets is out of line. If you look at the amount of fabric involved in making king size sheets , they are well worth the cost. Sure you could get cheaper sheets, but they would feel cheaper and they probably would have polyester or microfiber (UGH) blended in.I wash the top sheet, the fitted sheet and both pillow cases together. I have a pretty good size washer. However, when it comes to drying them, I dry the fitted sheet separately. Pillow cases get terribly winkled when they get caught up in the corners of the fitted sheet. So, the fitted sheet gets dried by itself. It then gets folded or put back on the bed. Then the top sheet and the pillow cases get dried. I always use dryer balls. The sheets come out great. Are they a little wrinkled? Sure but so what! The sheets are cotton and they are soft. Smooth them out a bit on the bed and they're perfect.Did I say these sheets are soft? They are but they are not thin. They have a substantial and luxurious feel. They don't feel like soft flannel. Good thing because I live in Florida. They don't feel like the fabric has been brushed or sueded.These are beautiful sheets that just keep getting better! Can't wait to buy my next set!

Review: I love these! I found them after staying at an airBnB, they had the king sized 1000 cotton ones. Those were very thick, I had never slept on sheets that thick before. Neither had my friend, she agreed they were lovely but she could not get over the thickness. I purchased the Threadmill 800 sateen ones in ivory for a queen. Here is what I found:  -compared to Pure Beech sheets (Bed, Bath & Beyond) these are way, way thicker. With Pure Beech I feel a large part of the softness is due to how thin the sheets are. A set lasts me less than a year before they start to wear in spots and get holes. Pure Beech sheets are also see through in the lighter colors, that is not the case with Threadmill-- I bought the ivory ones and cannot see through them, I also do not worry about washing Threadmill and them falling apart. Threadmill sateen sheets give me more of a thick/satin/cotton feel , with Pure Beech I get a thin/satin/silk feel.  -compared to Mellanni (Amazon-boasted as their highest rated, affordable sheet set) Threadmill sheets are also thicker than Mellanni. Mellanni is what the reviews claim though. They are a good, soft, durable sheet set, especially for the price and they come in so many colors. I switched to Mellanni when I got irritated with how often I was replacing my Pure Beech sheets and as a cheaper way to switch up my sheet colors without a hefty price. Threadmill still wins out for me, they are like the luxury version of Mellanni.  -Threadmill does wrinkle, if you like crisp sheets-- take them out of the dryer right away. The wrinkles do relax pretty quickly though.  -after washing and drying on low heat, the fitted sheet fits on my regular queen bed with plenty of excess under my bed. I could probably add a 2-3 inch topper and still be good.  -I expect the sheets will loosen with washes. Compare the thickness of these sheets to the thickness of a folded paper towel  -I read that people have issues finding which end the fitted sheet goes on the bed, a simple trick I found that applies to most sheet sheets is the tag in the inside of the fitted sheet goes on the bottom right hand corner of the bed. The tag on the bottom of the flat sheet goes in that same corner.Hope this helps :)

Review: These sheets have been an experience! Fortunately, in the end, a good one. If you want the quick version, scroll to the end. For details, read on!When I opened the package my heart dropped. These are thin enough to see through, have a weird almost rough feeling (at least if you're used to satin weave/Egyptian cotton like I am). I put them through the wash anyways and gave them a go. They washed very well per the given instructions and were much softer after washing, but still not a texture I am used to. I made my queen bed with them and found one corner has a saggy/baggy fit. I have a very thick mattress so usually sheets for deep mattresses are just fine...and it was only the one corner, so there is definitely some sort of fit issue. They have a crinkly linen look as advertised, which I don't mind at all and rather like. The color is nice/as advertised. I slept on them and was pleasantly surprised- and prompted to research washed cotton. The only issue is the odd fit in that one corner (better too big than too small at least). Also, after the second washing, they fit a bit better.These sheets are everything washed cotton is supposed to be! Washed cotton is supposed to be an open/airy weave (coarser) and very breathable. This is a feel you will either love or hate. I'm used to very smooth, well-worn Egyptian cotton and was very unsure at first. However, the texture really grew on me. Though a different feel, they are soft and pleasant, just in a different way. They hold a little more heat around my body and have less of the cold touch than Egyptian cotton, but they also breathe great (sounds like a weird combo, but they do). If you are a sweaty sleeper like me, these are a dream because they dry way faster than tigther weave Egyptian cotton/higher thread count sheets do.I docked the star for the odd fit and because I could not find a thread count specified anywhere. For this price, I feel that fit should be better and a thread count provided, even though it matters less for washed cotton than regular or Egyptian (from what I can find). However, the fabric is lovely to me. I want more washed cotton sheets now! I would not normally rate a poorly fitting sheet at 4 stars, so let that be an indication of how much I like the fabric and performance of the material. I hope the seller is able to incorporate size feedback and fix that issue, because these are otherwise fantastic and I would still recommend them based on comfort.Quick Version-True washed cotton feel and performance...which you will love or hate. Washed cotton is a looser/coarser weave but still soft. Read above or do some research first if you haven't used it before.-Breathe great, good for sweaty/warm sleepers.-Pretty color & attractive crinkly linen look.-Reasonably priced for 100% washed cotton, though I'd like to see a thread count easier to find and the fit issue corrected (see below).-Ample size for thick mattresses.-Fit issue: one corner was baggy and "off" (see photo)...it improved a bit with the second washing and attention to tucking extra fabric deeply under the mattress.
